# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

None.

Here is the Julia code that solves this problem:
```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df.dt)
    return df
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `:ym` to it, which is the concatenation of the year and month extracted from each date in `df[:dt]`. 

To use this function:
```julia
# Assuming 'df' is your DataFrame and 'dt' is the DateTime column
df = add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will modify the original DataFrame `df` in-place, adding a new column `:ym`. 

Please note that this function assumes that the DateTime column in your DataFrame is named "dt". If it has a different name, you would need to replace `"dt"` with the actual name of your DateTime column.
